Description: Handle-ornament from an Egyptian pottery oil-lamp in the form of a vine leaf. Covered with a brown slip. Red-brown Nile silt with mica inclusions. Handle and part of discus only.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Late first or early second century AD Egyptian parallels in the British Museum (Bailey 1988, Q1942-3, see also Q1920 for form), possibly copying Knidian forms of the period, see Q2702, Q2688). Similar forms known from Naukratis (Cambridge GR.215.1899; Boston RES.87.170) and from Tanis (Favard-Meeks in Brissaud and Zivie-Coche 1998, 116). Brissaud and Zivie-Coche. 1998. Tanis 1987-1997.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.10) (Phase 3)
